website_summaries.verdict: Undoubtedly the best value for your money.Will keep your baby busy for hours thanks to its abundant interactive features.
pros: A well-rounded walker for babies who are just learning to stand
cons: Can move a bit fast for beginners

customer_reviews.title: Great development tool!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a great alternative to walkers. My grandson loved it. He started by pulling himself up. He has since graduated to pushing. And he has learned some problem solving skills. Watch the video to see his skills.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda G. Jarema

customer_reviews.title: A great walker!
customer_reviews.text: I love the sit to stand function of this walker as it grows with the baby because the front part comes off. Another great feature is that the wheels lock to slow the baby down and rolls slowly on carpet. It is a little light weight so I do see my daughter not being able to pull up without it slightly tipping, so far she hasn’t fallen yet! The music is good and she loves the removable phone portion to it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Very misleading
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointed. I bought this product because my 7 month old daughter likes to pull up and stand. I thought this product would help her with that. The wheels don't lock so when she pulls up, it moves forward! Uggg
customer_reviews.author: vich0713

customer_reviews.title: Beware, big tip over factor
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old is in a standing phase and pulls himself up all the time. Knowing it was early for him to use this toy in earnest, I purchased it for when he is ready to take steps in the coming weeks and months. Just having this around his toys has proven to be dangerous. He crawls to it and tries to use it to steady himself and stand and has had several spills. We are hiding it until he is able to walk and push it. There are other sturdier (wood) walkers on the market that won’t tip over and can stay parked in the play area.
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: This walker is way too fast even with the slower setting and it tips over backwards. My smaller twin daughter kept falling when she pulls on the handle towards her and hurt her head. I don't recommend at all. Unless your child is 12 months or older or on the heavier side don't buy this. I bought Little Tikes 3-in-1 Activity Walker but exchanged it for this one do the the activity center and being removable but it was the wrong decision. I should've stuck with Little Tikes 3-in-1 Activity Walker. It was much sturdier and my twin daughters weren't falling on that walker.
customer_reviews.author: unhappy customer

customer_reviews.title: Brakes are not enough !!! Not safe for babies who are learning how to walk !! Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I read all these positive reviews for this walker having brakes and got this for my 11 mo who is learning to walk. The brakes don't provide enough resistance. The very second day by baby toppled with the walker as it was to fast and got a small cut on his lips The front portion is good but the walker itself is dangerous for the babies.I regret buying this for my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Abhay Bhangale

customer_reviews.title: No sound on our unit.  Very very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Looks fun, but the sound doesn't work. I was really looking forward to giving this to our baby on his first birthday in two days but it doesn't work, even with brand new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Raheen B

customer_reviews.title: New or used? I shouldn’t have to question it.
customer_reviews.text: I received the sit to stand and it seemed like it may have been used. It did not appear to be in the original packaging. When I went to put batteries in it because the instructions said that you need to install batteries there were batteries in it already. The more I looked I noticed it was dirty in some spots. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Encourages baby to walk
customer_reviews.text: My son INSTANTLY walked with this. The video attached is his first time using. He uses a walker, and takes a few steps here and there, but is still a little nervous. This helps! It’s a little pricy, I paid $34.99, but it’s very educational and hands-on. There are sensory options, a piano, a phone, many other things that keep baby entertained. It also detaches, so he can play with it on the floor. I’m happy that I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy but don't buy if you are looking for a good walker
customer_reviews.text: While my girl (from 7 months now 9 months) like to press all the buttons and chew on the items, the walkers wheel settings are really lacking. It's either so difficult to move the wheel that even I have difficult making the wheels move or it's so fast she falls. I wouldn't recommend buying this walker for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Wansy

customer_reviews.title: We have a mover!
customer_reviews.text: We love this! It’s actually our second one. We had one with my first son and sold it so we had to repurchase. We got it a bit earlier this time around which I found to be a great decision. He has been using it since about 9 months? Walks with it daily and is trying to put the shapes in their spots already. It has a resistance level which helps him not go too quick on the hardwood floor. The activity plate detaches which is great for tummy time or table play.
customer_reviews.author: DDaugherty

customer_reviews.title: Good toy ,Worst walker
customer_reviews.text: First of all let me start by saying beautiful looking toy but not a Walker. It is very lightweight. Even under supervision your child can easily trip.The back legs are so close that everytime my son tries to push it he hit his foot on them.The only reason I am still keeping it is because he love to play by pressing the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: alka anand

customer_reviews.title: Huge lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This was suggested to me by a friend and although I thought it was a bit expensive, it was totally worth it! My child loves it and it helped them start walking. He was standing and walking with us holding him but not able to do it well. This helped him walk while putting his weight on the toy. Within a day or two of use, he was walking around the house with it. Be careful to read the manual before assembling - it can be a tad bit confusing. Overall, great and it was definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ALT

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for my twin girls. Had a different one previously for my two year old. The good: Awesome for practicing standing and walking (with supervision). The front detaches and is very entertaining for your little ones, even if they aren’t quite ready to pull up. You’ll get a lot of use out of this for the money. It’s a must have for me. The bad: Be careful using on slick floors. The wheels have two settings to increase drag, but it will still slide extremely easily depending on the floor surface and your babe might not be able to keep up. Also, the phone does not have a cord so it can be easily lost.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan P

customer_reviews.title: Must have baby toy!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy... she’s almost 8 months. She will always crawl towards this and start to play with it. She is learning to stand and holds the back of it. It’s very nice looking and the tunes and sayings are cute and simple. I would def recommend this to other parents for babies even as early as NB. It’s fun for them to look at and listen to and it grows with them!
customer_reviews.author: rsmithski

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for baby!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for babies. There are multiple noises and lights that the machine makes when played with, and multiple tactile areas that produce noise or light. The sound is fairly clear as well. There are two different options for sounds as a on/off toggle on the board. It also functions as a walker. It plays a variety of songs and jingles, along with cute noises for baby. There are locks on the hind wheels however these are not very strong. The front panel is removable which is great because you can remove the play portion from the wheels on back if you want it to be stationary or on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Multi use
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves playing this toy. The sounds get his interest and the colors are vibrant too. Only giving 4 stars because of 2 reasons. 1. The telephone which is my son's favorite is already lost because it is now attached to the toy and the no. 2 reason is the walker part only has 2 options, stop and go which slides too fast. I wish theres another option that slowly moves the walker for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Lon

customer_reviews.title: Captures baby's interest
customer_reviews.text: My grandson really likes this toy. He sits on the floor and plays with it, while it is upright and attached to the walker. The toy is not heavy, and someone needs to be with the baby to ensure baby does not fall while learning to walk. The music is mildly annoying, not loud, and baby likes it. There are various versions of the Sit-to-Stand walker available. This one has the 'old fashioned' telephone handset -- and not many young adults have an old-fashioned phone in their homes; so this is fun for us old folks, us grandparents. lol
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Grammy is a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for my (now) one year old grandson, and boy does he love it! He loves the lights, colors and sounds and will clap his hands as he realizes he did that! He's just now pulling himself up, using Mommy's knee or a table; this not only allows him to stand, but even take some tentative steps by himself. He had been taking steps, holding Mommy's hands (fingers) or his big sister's, but now he can do it himself and this toy is boosting his confidence and independence. Truly a wonderful gift, making Grammy a hit once again. I highly recommend this wonderful learning toy.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Lyne DuShane

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old approves
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this for my son. Bought when he was about 10 months, he's played with it daily for 3 months now. Its a toy he often goes to by himself and will entertain himself for 5 or 10 minutes, longer if someone plays with him. He isn't walking yet but when I assist him and put his hands on the bar of the toy he enjoys walking with it. Its easy to move around and I haven't had a problem with anything falling off or being cheap. It has a couple sound settings so its not super loud either. And in 3 months I haven't had to change the batteries yet. One of my favorite toys.
customer_reviews.author: Jess 000

customer_reviews.title: Super nice toy my 8 month old grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: Super nice toy. My 8 month old grandson loves it, as usual it came nicely packaged and on time. He actually was holding on to the handle and pushing it while “walking” a few steps. We have one of these in our church nursery and all the “about to walk toddlers” seem to prefer it to similar toys. I was comfortable in purchasing this for Christmas because Amazon always comes through both in packaging and timely deliveries. Shopping Amazon at Christmas has made my favorite holiday even Merrier, taking the stress out of the hustle and bustle of the malls and giving me more time to just enjoy the season!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, might be better walkers though!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy but, we were looking for a walker that made noise because she was pushing it. THIS walker has great interactive toys but none that are because she is walking with it. She does walk with it though and the phone on the front has given her a reason to one hand the walker while pushing it with the phone in the other.
customer_reviews.author: nasus

customer_reviews.title: Watch out-here comes speedy!!
customer_reviews.text: It has taken me a while to review this toy because of health issues. My 20 month old granddaughter has one of these so I ordered one for my 20 month old grandson. As soon as this was easily set up, he started playing with all the buttons and colorful items on the front. We had to show him how he could hold the handle so he could walk while pushing it. Now, watch out because he will run you over when he shifts into hyperspeed. He doesn’t say much yet but I am sure he likes it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My little one loves it. Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! Would recommend to anyone! The back wheels lock in case you don't want your little one pushing it around, or need it to stationary for a non-walker. The play piece on the front comes off, and can be played with apart from the walker part. Cute songs, the buttons on top light up, the gears are fun to turn but also make songs go faster or slower. There is a high and low volume switch. Also a learning or fun switch (but they are both fun!) The little barn door opens as well. The yellow phone comes off of the toy, and is not connected.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Doctors recommend against walking toys until after a child can walk
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this toy. The American academy of Pediatrics says these are very bad. My granddaughters doctor writes it at the end of his notes to her parents.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Grand daughter loved it.
customer_reviews.text: She has been pulling her self up for at least 6 weeks but hasn't let go yet. I thought this would help. The only thing I don't like are all the musical sounds seem to go at one time instead of being separate. But they can be turned off, thank god! Her mother walked at 6 and a half months old 100% and was crawling and sitting up alone at 5 months. My grand daughter wants to but is not as fearless as her mother was. She is 8 months. Any day I look for her to let go.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Y. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: My boy still isn’t walking but it’s no fault of the walker. I think he realizes the floor is hard and has a fear of falling. He does somersaults across the bed and in the playpen but once he’s on the floor, to his bottom he goes. He’s getting there though and I would recommend this walker. What I like most is the play pad detaches so even when he’s not walking he still has something to keep him engaged. This seems to be the best Walker according to my research and the one that showed up most often during my searches.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love how the wheels lock in place or you can have them go full on rolling. This was the deciding factor to get for my daughter. My daughter has been pulling herself up since 6 months so at 7 months she grabbed this and started walking easily with the wheels lock so she just pushed it. The tray table of toys detaches so they can play with it on the floor or they can play with it propped on the walker. I loved the lavender color because blue or green is all that's usually in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lora

customer_reviews.title: The easiest children's toy to put together yet!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my nephew. It literally took less than 3-minutes to put together. It took longer to put the batteries in than put the actual toy together. We love that the front activity panel can be easily removed and taken in the car, etc. It was easy enough for 8 and 11-yr old siblings to help remove the panel and replace. All the different activities that light up and interact, are great! Wish I had purchased more than one to hold onto as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: MBC

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I only have good things to say!! This thing is so entertaining that I enjoy playing with it myself. My nice in completely obsessed with that purple phone. It’s hilarious! She is a bit lazy and this has motivated to stand and reach. Great investment. Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is great for babies learning to stand and walk and also just for entertaining themselves with the different buttons, colors and sounds. I love that the wheels have 2 settings (which is why I bought this particular walker), however, even on the harder setting (the wheels don't turn easily when pushing as opposed to the easy setting where they do) the walker slides a little too quickly for a baby just learning to balance and walk. If that feature were improved upon, this would be a 6 star product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxious and overstimulating
customer_reviews.text: I love these types of baby walkers, but this one in particular has waaaayyyyy too much going on in the front. The activity pad is chaos... it’s not a simple cause-and-effect learning and music board, it makes noises and music that seem completely unrelated to whether or not any buttons are pushed. The sounds and music are over-the-top obnoxious and play for way too long. The sounds should stop once the toy is no longer being played with, but they’ll keep going forever if you don’t turn it off. It would be AMAZING if vtech would make a new activity board that we could replace this one with, because I love the walker design.
customer_reviews.author: Jim&Ang H.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely a cute little baby Walker. I will say that I'm not 100% comfortable with my baby using this on out hard wood floor (we have both carpet and hardwood). Yes, the wheels do have a rubber seem, but the front wheels don't, so it's a little shaky on hardwood. A child with more walking experience would probably be ok with the hardwood, but definitely not a beginner Walker. Other than that, it's nice. I had trouble hooking the wheels in, but then I felt stupid when I realized how simple it was to get in lol
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra carver

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy, fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old grandson loves this! It’s very sturdy, it is stable and does not roll too fast. I love that the wheels have 2 settings, we are using the one that keep the wheels at a slow pace since he is learning to walk. He is about 25 lbs and it is strong and sturdy enough to so he can pull himself up. He loves the lights and music and all the little toys. I also like the fact that you can remove the play station. I wanted something that would be strong and sturdy so he would not fall or have it roll too fast for him, this is perfect and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: This toy never grows old!  Your child might but they still enjoy this toy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item in 2013 for an early walker granddaughter to play with. Her brother is now 4 and both of them still enjoy different aspects of the toy. It is a perfect toy for early childhood. They will enjoy operating it, taking it apart, putting it back together again, playing the musical parts, and especially, chasing around with it. It has been at the ready for 6 years now. I recently loaned it to a neighbor with small child guests arriving. When he returned it he said it was the favorite toy on hand they had for his twins' visit.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Charles C. Brewer, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: My 1+ year old daughter loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: Before she could walk, my baby daughter loved playing with the buttons/lights/music. As she got older, she used it as a "walker" (I kept the brakes on so it would remain locked and sturdy). Once she learned to walk, the brakes came off and she used it to walk and run on her own. Now that she's 16+ months, she runs around the house with it all the time. One of the best toys we've gotten for her - consistently plays with it and continues to do so!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good toy and good walker.
customer_reviews.text: My baby immediately took to the walker. He loves it. I love that it's a two piece toy. The front comes off so he can play with the items on the front on the couch or bed. The walker operates with or with out the toy on the front. Very great item for the money. I can't say my baby is walking with out it, but he does feel comfortable crawling up to it and it's sturdy enough that he can pull himself up and it doesn't roll off and he uses it to push and walk.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: It has a slow control wheel setting! Whoohoo!! And it comes in pink!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and sturdy walker. Bought the puppy laugh and play and it's made with cheap plastic, so it bends when you push it. We replaced it the Fisher Price Laugh and Play with this VTech (had the same one when my boys were little) and love it. It is very sturdy and the best feature is that it has 2 roll settings. It has a slow control lock for the wheels and a regular roll setting. I also love that it comes in pink. There are also plenty of activities on it that are cute. Best Walker EVER!! I would highly recommend for any new learner
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Lovely design
customer_reviews.text: It's lovely and it has a bunch of features that kinda confuses me like other toys. You don't know the logic of how a sound is activated. Anyway, my daughter plays with it, sometimes pushes it. The only thing that it should improve is the wheel design, which is also a good concept that is built in to have 2 settings of resistance. The wheels are too slippary and I think they can improve them with rubbers or silicone type.
customer_reviews.author: Fujiang

customer_reviews.title: Amazing For Learning To Walk
customer_reviews.text: Baby Loves! Got it for when my son was 9 months. He's turning one soon and still is in love with this toy. My 2 favorite things about this is that the wheels are adjustable so it wont go too fast for babies just learning to walk and later you can make the wheels go faater. Also the activity center comes off for when baby is sitting down. I love it! Very interactive and catches babys attention right away :)
customer_reviews.author: Viviana

customer_reviews.title: MAKES SOUND FOR NO REASON
customer_reviews.text: this thing is the most annoying toy ive bought for my son.it just goes through a random circle of songs and then it doesn't stop when your child is no longer interested. There is no way it can teach anything. its random and non stop and annoying. I would not have gotten this nor would I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: No cord for the phone; easy to get misplaced
customer_reviews.text: I remember ordering this VTech sit to stand walker for my nephew in 2015. I clearly remember the phone having a cord holding it to the toy panel. The same cord the shapes have to put back on their respective places. This one that I ordered does not have a cord. The phone could easily be misplaced. I don't know if maybe this is the only sit and stand that does not come with the cord for the phone or if it is a damage product.
customer_reviews.author: JayCast

customer_reviews.title: Loved by little one
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old son has loved this since we got it about a month ago. The only negative as some of the reviewers have said is that the wheels, although "locked" still allow the product to move. Once my child started pulling up to stand, I had to sit with him while he was playing with this toy so he didn't hurt himself falling trying to stand with it. Once your child can balance standing/walking on their own, I'm sure it can be used to be pushed around, but before then, keep a close eye. Still worth the money though for how much my child likes it.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying song 🤦‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Baby seems to like this toy. She’s 9 months old. We turn the toy into the lock mode so that she can’t push it but she still manages to push it so almost hits her face on the ground as it moves away from her when she’s leaning on it. It also plays the same annoying song over and over, which of course she doesn’t mind but it drives me crazy. Other toys repeat songs too, but this is the same one song again and again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Pezzanite

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old loves this toy. He loves the lights. He loves the very obnoxious songs that seem to be nursery rhyme remixes. He loves the phone. He has fallen a couple of times when trying to push it but that's to be expected when learning to walk. I like that you can remove the front part and take it on the go. The colors are hideously garish but overall it's a good toy.
customer_reviews.author: Yuki Nozoe

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This walker is awesome! My baby loves the music and sounds on it. She constantly pulls herself up and walks across the room with the cart. I do wish there were 1 or 2 more levels of resistance in between the 2 choices on the dial (on the 2 setting the tension is very tight, on 1 the wheels move freely). It’s still a great toy and helps with learning to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Was a big hit with my nephew!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 11-month-old nephew, and his parents sent me videos almost immediately of him playing with it and zooming it around with glee. I will say that when my son was young, we had purchased something similar for him, but that item never really did the trick in assisting with standing/walking because it rolled or tipped too easily when he tried to grab it to stand, but did not roll easily enough when he tried to push it around. This item, however, for my nephew seemed to work exactly as I'd hoped, judging by the videos I was sent. Big smiles! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this! She was just over 7 months when we got this walker for her, since she’s an early movement baby it has encouraged her to keep going! She loves spinning the gears and the rollers, takes the phone everywhere, and even figured out how to walk with it. It does play a lot of sounds and music so if that bothers you, just be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmasda

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy But Not New
customer_reviews.text: This walker arrived and was as described. However, I was purchasing a "new" item, but it doesn't appear to be. The screw area for the battery cover had several scratches, and there were 2 AA batteries installed. The batteries were not supposed to be included and were not the correct type, i.e. should have been alkaline per the instructions. I expect this is a returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Jadeladi

customer_reviews.title: Cute, engaging, useful toy
customer_reviews.text: This is the third VTech I have bought for my granddaughter. The brand did not exist when my own children were babies. The toys pretty much share the same activity features. They also share the same quality. I’m very pleased with them and will continue buying them. My granddaughter is still too young to walk. She uses the toy on the floor. So, I cannot comment on the ‘walker’ aspect of the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Azita

customer_reviews.title: Piece of toy was popped off by the baby...
customer_reviews.text: So this walker is honestly a FANTASTIC purchase, all the way from the activities it provides on the panel, to the drag assisted wheels!!! Absolutely the only reason for 3 stars is that, we let our kid use it all the time (that's the point) but the door the the barn on the panel was pulled off BY THE BABY and is an absolute choking hazard....we just leave the door off it now, but truly could be DANGEROUS if your baby is even slightly above average strength...

customer_reviews.title: Good but wheels do not lock, which can be dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I like the various engaging items on the walker. I also like the color and user-friendly options. The phone detaches and baby takes with her sometimes. This can also be a con but yet to be misplaced. Con: The wheels do not lock properly. It does not matter what surface it is on, it still moves when locked. Poor girl has fallen on it and slid to splits as it moved away without her pushing it. Couldn't be bothered to complain about it to Amazon or manufacturer. I just push it against a wall when she just wants to stand. I typically don't have her on it if an adult is not with in catching reach.
customer_reviews.author: Carlene C

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, safe, and fun for my baby
customer_reviews.text: I was really scared of having my baby use the walker because I was afraid she would slip and fall, but thankfully this walker has speed options and it makes it easier for my daughter to have a steady step rather than having her trying not to fall. My baby loves to play with the toys and it makes it easy to assemble. Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: perfect for an almost walking baby
customer_reviews.text: I really like how colorful it is and all of the activities. I only let one wheel turn at this time so that she does not lose control while she is just learning to use it. she seems to love it! She is not quite sure what the phone is for since she is so used to seeing cell phones :-) I am very pleased with this and happy that I did get it for her. She is almost one but not quite walking so I think this will help her a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hersom

customer_reviews.title: Very cute walking aid
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves this walker!! I love that it has tension adjustments for the wheels so they don’t roll out too far in front of her. She loves to pull up from standing on her own using the handle as support. I also really like that you can take the white part off and use as a floor toy. The farm theme is cute- the songs and buttons keep her entertained for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter isn't quite walking yet, just standing, but I decided to get this because I did not want a typical baby walker. It's pretty good, she loves the toy in the front the most right now if I must be honest lol. It seems a bit wobbly however she hasn't gotten the hang of walking yet so she applies all her little body weight to this little walker lol. I'll update when she starts walking.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila Winston

customer_reviews.title: Great, versatile toy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for an Easter gift for our 6-month-old grandson. He immediately began playing with the tummy toy part, even though we anticipated it might be a while before he used it. It will be a wonderful walking toy, too, in a few months. Very simple to attach/detach the tummy toy to the stand up, but I did have a little trouble getting legs attached at first. Highly recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Larri

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this , so many things to do on it . My granddaughter approves . She loves walking with it and sitting to play on it . My Aussie also approves ! When my granddaughter isn't here I will catch my furson playing with it ,turning it on and all . Gotta love Aussies. Highly recommended. Lot's more things than most of them to do .
customer_reviews.author: MoonStar

customer_reviews.title: Comes with batteries/Easy Assemble
customer_reviews.text: It’s so cute and my son loves it.i put it together in less than 3 minutes.Easiest assembly I’ve done from Amazon.comes with batteries.He runs with it,he likes all the buttons and the phone.Hes tipped over with it so if your kid runs maybe stay behind him or child proof Incase of fall.My kid is almost 9 months and 22 lbs idk if that helps.also we have carpet and it slides the same as it would on floor
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to loose phone.
customer_reviews.text: Love that it has two ‘speed’ settings for the wheels so it’s not too fast for new or learning walkers. Wish the phone was attached by a string or something though because my daughter keeps loosing it. Being able to detach the front so it can be played with not on the walker is awesome. My daughter enjoys sitting and playing it flat.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, helps little ones learn to walk. Not good on tile. Works safer on carpet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy. There are lots of activities and music to keep the attention of the child. As far as helping them walk, it's really great for that too but I won't let go yet. My granddaughter is only starting to walk and she puts all her weight on the toy as she takes a step. It's safer con carpet but moves quite a bit instead of rolling. Maybe as she supports herself more, it won't scoot so much. It's still a great toy, but we need to make sure they are safe. Alot of people want things that take a human's place. Just an FYI
customer_reviews.author: roberta2427

customer_reviews.title: The legs are not that simple.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like how annoying it was to figure out how to put the legs on. It was worded simple but it doesn't snap lock into place like i was thinking. The holes have to be aligned at a certain angle and then the handle goes in after and snaps the three pieces into place. It actually really frustrated me. I couldn't figure these dumb big plastic legs out. I can put together almost anything. It's cute.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Enchanted

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy. So I did. My baby is 10 months and he get bored really fast with thing but this he absolutely loves. Putting it together was super easy. I’m so happy I found this toy. This has helped in many way. My husband is deployed so my baby only knows me. Everywhere I go my baby go with this toy he will stay and play with it. I’m beyond happy I found this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Rena Cloman

customer_reviews.title: Son Learned to Pull Himself Up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my 10 month old for Christmas. It was super easy to assemble and he LOVES it! He is constantly playing with it so my parents also bought one for their house. He learned to pull himself up by using this toy and now he pulls himself up on everything he can! My only small complaint is that it doesn’t fold down so it takes up space in my car when I want to take it up to our cabin, go to a friends, etc. Other than that, I’m so glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and full of activities.
customer_reviews.text: i really love the VTech Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker because of the vibrant and lively colors.It has a lot of activities for my baby to play with whenever he is tired of pushing.He sits close to and keep touching the buttons and he loves the different sounds that come out. The walker is so light that my baby lifts it slightly off the ground and falls with the walker falling right on him.So to avoid the fall i always stand behind him to stop him from falling.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe for standing babies
customer_reviews.text: Before my daughter began to stand I would’ve given this toy 5 stars. It really does entertain her. Now that she is standing and I’ve started to use the portion with the wheels, I’ve completely changed my mind. The wheels don’t lock so it’s not exactly meant for a “standing” child because it moves. Also my daughter tried to use this to pull up and it tilted backwards, caused her to fall and the toy fell on top of her. When she begins to walk I might feel more comfortable allowing her to play with this. Right now, it’s unsafe and poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 9 month old child as a device that sparks interest in the various sounds available on the toy, and as a stimulus to stand and push the device for walking development. I found the toy to be of quality manufacture, highly durable, attractive and a key attraction based on the various stimuli on the toy; kids seem to like it a lot. I would recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Circle B Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Good fun toy
customer_reviews.text: 9 month old does love to hit the buttons. He likes to use it to put himself up to standing, but the toy doesn't stand still (it moves) which he & I don't like (and why I had to take some stars from rating). Only the wheels in the back "lock". I like how many buttons and sound options you have and a loud and lower volume which is super nice. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KittyKat

customer_reviews.title: which is nice, so she could have it laying on the ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this! Before she was ready to use the walking part of it, she was obsessed with the front activity portion. I stil have some of the sayings memorized and stuck in my head from hearing her play with it every day. I was pleasantly surprised to realize that the wheels had two settings (a slightly harder/slower and a more easy/quicker one). This was extremely helpful to her when she first started using the walker to walk with. The activity portion on the front also detaches, which is nice, so she could have it laying on the ground to play with if she wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Wiant

customer_reviews.title: My sons favorite toy already
customer_reviews.text: My baby LOVES this!!! He saw me take it out the box and just knew it was for him before it was even assembled. It was easy to assemble with only 3 pieces to attach, the handle and two legs. I love that it came with batteries already in place. I wish it was a little louder but that’s not too much of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter and she really loves playing with it. There are so many activities packed into the removable front that she doesn't seem to losing interest now that she's had it a while. The rear wheels have some sort of mechanism that don't fully lock them but does add a lot of friction. As she is learning to stand and take her first steps with the aid of this toy, it allows her to walk without having it roll right out from under her.
customer_reviews.author: CrashBoy

customer_reviews.title: It is a VTech. You really can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years we have bought several VTech learning toys. We have never been dissatisfied. The age recommendations tend to be spot on. If you need to but something for a child that all you know is their age, buy a VTech. I imagine that you will be surprised at the reception the gift receives. My wife bought this without consulting me. It is absolutely perfect for one of our great grand sons.
customer_reviews.author: MartnGale

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice if I could use it. Sent me two of the same legs. Trying to get ahold of Vtech was nearly impossible because apparently my model number was invalid. Should have just purchased at Walmart and spent the extra few bucks. Now to go through the hassle and ship this back. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 6 month old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6m old, who is advanced for her age, and already wanting to walk on her own. She took to it quickly and enjoys the opportunity to walk around the house. For an infant learning to walk, the second speed is perfect (she stays on the carpet which also provides needed friction). It gives her the opportunity to take one step at a time at a pace she is comfortable at. The activity tablet will also keep her entertained with all the noise and buttons. Overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest thing to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Found this most difficult to assemble. One leg is marked with an R, the other an L, so one on the right, one on the left, simple, right? Nope. So I reversed it and then the legs go into place, works, go figure, (mine must have been mis-labeled), then keeping it steady to push the handle into the slots, not so easy. You really need two people, so one can hold it in place. Hopefully it stays sturdy for my granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: sports fan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for years
customer_reviews.text: Lasted many years overall we kept misplacing the phone as it isn’t attached but the product is nice because it can be unattached from the wheels and be a lap toy. If you’re getting this to teach your child to walk please be aware that it’s not going to help because yes it’ll hold them up but once they start taking steps the toy will continue to roll forward so don’t leave your just learning to walk children unsupervised with this toy. Overall this is a great toy for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Jerami

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Baby seems to like it, but from a parent's perspective, there are things that could be better. Locking the back wheels doesn't really prevent it from moving since the front wheels aren't lockable as well. And the phone handle isn't attached with a cord like the other removable items on the toy. We just removed the phone handle and put it in a drawer so it won't get lost, or used as a "weapon" by a curious toddler who often visits. So I'm giving it 4 stars because baby enjoys it. If the other items were addressed, it would easily be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Mama for Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not so much a walker
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter would only use as a walker if we nudged her in the right direction and once it hit a wall she wouldn’t use it anymore. As a toy she likes it, pushing buttons and all that. The phone was lost on the first day, they should have attached it but I get not wanting a long cord for choking reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Random

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the toys
customer_reviews.text: My son really loves this walker toy. The greatest benefit was the staged resistance on the wheels. This helped him get comfortable with applying weight onto the walker at first and when he got a better handle of his balance, we removed the resistance all together. He literally runs with his walker now and is really enjoying the freedom. As for the interactive panel - I am so glad there’s some volume control. My kid has to have the sound on when he walks.
customer_reviews.author: Sara K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fun, daughter loves!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered early! Came with batteries in it already, huge bonus! Works perfectly, my 6 month old daughter already loves it after just a few minutes of play! Easy to assemble only took me about 2 minutes to click pieces into place. Only con so far is phone is removable and I can see it getting lost without an attached cord but perfect otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Sackett

customer_reviews.title: Cute & Useful with One Issue
customer_reviews.text: My 10-month-old is entertained by this walker. The only gripe I have with it, is the resistance is not good enough in my opinion for a baby learning to stand. When my daughter tries to pull herself up with this, she of course also pushes on it, and the walker moves forward. I understand this is a walker, but it does say "sit-to-STAND," so I was expecting a bit more of a resistance to be one of the options (it has 2 resistance options). Other than that, my daughter enjoys playing with it, especially the phone & opening/closing the little "barn door."
customer_reviews.author: Jessica VazquezTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I son loves playing with the board and pushing the cart around. We have had no issues with its quality. Not very heavy to keep little one from falling backwards but with help he loves practicing walking with it. He also will crawl and push it or sit and play with it. Love it . 9 month old plays with it perfect
customer_reviews.author: Martie

customer_reviews.title: We use without electronic board
customer_reviews.text: Our baby has put in so much time with this toy! Got it at 8 months and it still keeps him busy at 10 months. Fun to see him gain more control with it. I don't like to buy electronic toys but trust the sturdiness of this one above wooden competitors. I just never put the electronic board on the face and it still works great without all the bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived fun
customer_reviews.text: These vTech toys all seem to suffer the same issues - they all spam lights and sounds, and do so in an incoherent way. They just have too much going on sometimes all at once. This makes them virtually garbage after the novelty wears off for the child and unbearably annoying for adults. The quality is fine, but our daughter actually feared using this as a walker for some reason, and the fun of smashing all the buttons and knobs wore off quickly..
customer_reviews.author: Cody G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and keeps my littles attention!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Easy to assemble. Vibrant colors. Volume setting. Easy take along toy release. Safety locks on wheels. Just the right height. Dislikes: Toy phone does not stay in place. The shapes on the cords are stretched out and do not click in place like they should. The lights on a few buttons don’t work sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbi Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Lights went out after three months of use
customer_reviews.text: Great toy my son loved it, but the lights went out after three months of using it. I changed the batteries and everything. I guess it's just defective.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Toddlers Entertained
customer_reviews.text: My nephew from the age of 8 months to 16 months, would play with the Learning Walker for a few hours per day. He absolutely loved it! Plus, there is an adjustable sound button, so you can lessen the noise when you can't taking the beeping any more. However, I would say that the noises it does make are on the less annoying end of the spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Jay

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 11 month old daughter and she loves it! its really helped her get comfortable with walking. She also loves the phone and all the animal noises. My only complaint is the wheel don't rotate to well on hardwood floors, just kind of locks and slides across the floor which can be dangerous is the child doesn't have good balance yet
customer_reviews.author: IllWill718

customer_reviews.title: The best of the basic models
customer_reviews.text: All around great and helps our little one move about. The songs on it don't drive my husband nuts which is an added bonus. Two things I wish were improved: that the telephone was attached/affixed because any toddler will lose it in about 2 seconds of owning it. That the front wheels would have an option to be able to swivel to allow easier turning for the tot.
customer_reviews.author: S S Minn

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Item doesnt work. Assembles just fine but the sound doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Grand babies love it. They play with it from crawling to about 2 1/2 years. Very sturdy. First grandchild used it for about 3 years then the next grandchild did the same. Still in good shape. Going to sell it now as its still working well and no more grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: papa

customer_reviews.title: Stable for beginning walkers. Engaging toy.
customer_reviews.text: The features of the toy are fun and engaging for many months of development. I love that the wheels can be adjusted to roll easier or more resistant, according to the baby's ability and stability. My daughter has another walker, from a different company, that the baby just is not interested in.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rozzi

customer_reviews.title: Quality toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 10-month old grandson can stand while holding on to something, but cannot walk. The walker part of this toy is fabulous! My grandson held on and walked with it the first time he tried it! The toys on the front come off in one piece and contains some very good options for the baby to play with. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: CTito

customer_reviews.title: Can't support babies weight
customer_reviews.text: This can't even support babies weight! When my babies try to pull themselves up it falls over. If I stand them up on it if I let go it falls backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan and Shannon Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby!
customer_reviews.text: My little one LOVES this! I think his favorite part is taking the phone off the "hook" and putting it back on. He's also using it a lot in order to help him "walk" around. You do have to keep an eye on the little ones when they are walking with it and pulling up as he's fallen back a couple of times just because of the weight and balance. It's also nice that it has the option to take the activity portion off the walker and you can just put that on the floor and not have to worry about them trying to walk with it.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Funny to watch the kids navigate
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis on both my thumbs so for me it was difficult to assemble but after a little try it worked. It has two settings on the back wheels which you can set 1 & 2, for tension. I set it on 1 and still had to hold my grandchild by the shirt because she was going so fast, she was falling all over the place. She loves it tho! She loves when she runs into the wall and tries to change course. Overall it's fun to watch her figure out how to navigate away from a corner but scary when she's racing out of control down a hallway.
customer_reviews.author: Lourdesmac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son's 1st birthday. He wasn't really standing on his own yet. The lights and sounds on the front of the walker kept him well entertained and 5 months later, it still does. He loves pretending to talk to people on the little yellow phone. Now he's also using it to help with his walking skills. It was easy to lighten up on the wheel resistance so he can go at his own pace now. Works well on hardwood, carpet and tile. I also love that it's light enough that he can maneuver it in a different direction when he gets to a wall or to go around tables/chairs/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Hosking

customer_reviews.title: No sound! 2nd review. Return request is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 month old son. He absolutely loves it! The one I originally had bought, did not have sound. I requested a new one and hopefully it will have sound! I didn't like the fact that I had to take it away from my baby and send it back because it didn't properly for the purchase that I paid for it. Other than that issue great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hand

customer_reviews.title: Fun Educational and Engaging
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. First was for my 15 month old great nephew and second one was for my 1yr old grandson. This is a perfect toy to help learning how to walk. It is also educational and great for little hands to feel all the cool buttons and gadgets on the front. It is really neat to watch the m use it. Very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: JeanieS

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, not as great as a walker
customer_reviews.text: I like that the front toy console area can be taken off of the walking part--but to be honest the walking part isn't really sturdy enough to use without a lot of help. If my baby leans back at all, this will topple over ontop of her. The wheels have two modes, and neither has enough traction to stop her from landing on her face. The front side is fun to use though. If there was something that could extend the reach so parents could more easily walk along and control the speed and uprightness of the toy, it would be easier to use for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

product_meta.title: VTech Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker (Frustration Free Packaging)
product_meta.description:
Color:Orange| Style:SingleFrom baby steps to big steps The Sit-to-Stand learning walker by VTech helps your child develop from a crawler to a walker through adaptive technology.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From baby steps to big steps the Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker by VTech helps your baby develop from a crawler to a walker through adaptive technology. With a barnyard of playful friends to cheer them on, your little one will have endless fun as they learn to walk. Start out with the easy-to-remove activity panel for floor play or on-the-run fun, then step it up with the fun-to-maneuver walker. Spinning gears, five piano keys, three colorful rollers, three light-up shape sorters, three light-up buttons and a telephone handset offers endless fun that will stimulate your baby’s learning and develop their motor skills. The Sit-to-Stand Learning Walker keeps baby on track teaching shapes, colors, animals, music and more!
feature_bullets: Interactive learning baby Walker has a removable play panel; frustration free packaging means it comes in a plain brown box
Early learning center has 5 piano keys that play music and encourage creativity; wheels work on carpeted and hard floors
Features 2 colorful spinning rollers, 3 shape sorters, and 3 light-up buttons that develop motor skills
Pretend telephone handset and mechanical elements enhance role-play fun; 2 AA batteries are included
Over 70 sing-along songs, music, sound effects and fun phrases; meant for babies and toddlers 9 months to 3 years old. Sensory development

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars20,616 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
